revised_title: Investigation of Pressure Coefficients of Hydrogen and Helium and Vapour Pressures of Oxygen and Hydrogen
tldr: The authors investigate the pressure coefficients of hydrogen and helium at constant volume and initial pressures, as well as the vapour pressures of liquid oxygen and hydrogen at temperatures below their boiling points. They find that pure helium is a more perfect thermometric substance than hydrogen and suggest it as a potential new standard for temperature scales.
